results.definition: a very high narrow heel on women's shoes
any holding device consisting of a rigid, sharp-pointed object
examples: the spike pierced the receipts and held them in order

results.definition: pierce with a sharp stake or point
bring forth a spike or spikes
fruiting spike of a cereal plant especially corn

examples: they used spikes to fasten the rails to a railroad tie

results.definition: a long, thin sharp-pointed implement (wood or metal)
examples: one of the spikes impaled him

results.definition: a sharp-pointed projection along the top of a fence or wall (or a dinosaur)
a sharp rise followed by a sharp decline
examples: the seismograph showed a sharp spike in response to the temblor

results.definition: a transient variation in voltage or current
(botany) an indeterminate inflorescence bearing sessile flowers on an unbranched axis
each of the sharp points on the soles of athletic shoes to prevent slipping (or the shoes themselves)
examples: the second baseman sharpened his spikes before every game
golfers' spikes damage the putting greens

results.definition: sports equipment consisting of a sharp point on the sole of a shoe worn by athletes
